title: Fighting woman on board causes emergency landing - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Fighting woman on board causes emergency landing
An outrageous passenger on board an American Airlines flight caused an emergency landing on Monday. A 25-year old Chicago woman allegedly hit two people including a flight attendant on board a flight from Miami to Chicago. The pilot had to diver the plane to Indianapolis to make an emergency landing.
The strange incident took place on the American Airlines Flight 1284 on Monday, when an unruly passenger allegedly struck another flier, and then a flight attendant. According to the other passengers on the plane the woman appeared to be under the impression of alcohol.
The pilot told passengers the cabin was being locked down, and the flight was being diverted to Indianapolis International Airport. When it landed, police placed the woman in flex cuffs, and removed her from the plane.
The woman reportedly shouted “call my mom” when she was being led off the plane.
